paragraphs.content: A Song or Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A Song or Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.

paragraphs.content: Awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Awake, psaltery and harp: I myself will awake early.

paragraphs.content: I will praise thee, O LORD, among the people: and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will praise thee, O Lord, among the people: and I will sing praises unto thee among the nations.

paragraphs.content: For thy mercy is great above the heavens: and thy truth reacheth unto the clouds.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thy mercy is great above the heavens: and thy truth reacheth unto the clouds.

paragraphs.content: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth;

paragraphs.content: That thy beloved may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That thy beloved may be delivered: save with thy right hand, and answer me.

paragraphs.content: God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.

paragraphs.content: Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Gilead is mine; Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;

paragraphs.content: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe; over Philistia will I triumph.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe; over Philistia will I triumph.

paragraphs.content: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?

paragraphs.content: Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wilt not thou, O God, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our hosts?

paragraphs.content: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

paragraphs.content: Through God we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Through God we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.
